text: The Mary Reed House, AKA "Mary Reed Residence" was built and designed in 1909 for the widow of philanthropist and real estate pioneer Byron Reed. It was built in the Gold Coast area of Omaha, Nebraska, which in the early 20th century was a neighborhood of great prestige. This red-brick building, now home to a law firm, was designed by architect F.A. Henninger in the Prairie style made famous by Frank Lloyd Wright. Located at 503 S. 35th St. in Omaha; it was designated as an Omaha Historical Landmark in 1982. ==References== Category:Houses in Omaha, Nebraska
title: Mary Reed House
